other_tests.findings: An accessory LA appendage was identified on the anterior LA wall. Premature atrial contractions were demonstrated arising from the left superior and inferior pulmonary veins, and a further source was found originating from within the accessory LA appendage.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Radiofrequency ablation of the appendage orifice resulted in cessation of the arrhythmia. At 3-month follow-up, the patient remained symptom-free with no evidence of recurrent atrial fibrillation.
